name: Pre-Order for Contemporary Geometric Beadwork, Vol. II (in progress)
description:
Of course we are making a second volume! How could we not? Volume I, as spectacular as it is, is just the beginning of our explorations. 

Pre-orders are only meant for people who know they want the book no matter when it comes out, and want to support the process and receive advance patterns. We can't say whether we will deliver for Christmas or Easter, but we can promise you another beautiful volume full of original work. Yours included, if you bead with us!

We hope you'll stay in touch with us online- we'll share our process, new ideas, we'll give you peeks and drawings to keep you beading, and invite you to advance-bead our new patterns. And of course, just as in Vol. 1, we'll be photographing the most exciting pieces for the book. Please SUBSCRIBE to the Book Blog (subscription link is in the upper right corner) if you would like email updates in your inbox- no direct emails will be sent.

(Copy and paste links if they aren't clickable.)

Book Blog:
www.ContemporaryGeometricBeadwork.com

Facebook page:
www.facebook.com/ContemporaryGeometricBeadwork

Thank you for your support and your participation in our ongoing adventure! It is much appreciated! All pre-ordered books will come signed, with extras.

name: Contemporary Geometric Beadwork, Volume I: Matte Paper Edition
description:
Yes! We would love to send you a signed, spiral bound copy of the wildly popular Contemporary Geometric Beadwork (with bonus postcards!)

You have two choices when you buy this book- a 250 page, full-colour matte paper book ($40) or a digital-only copy ($15). (The paper book comes with a free digital copy. The digital-only copy is sold as a separate item in this shop.)

-- Right now, before we go to press with Volume II, we are offering a special on multiple copies of our glorious, non-reflective, Earth-friendlier Matte Paper edition of Volume I- get them while we have them! See "Options" below to select 1, 2, or 4 copies. 

There is no extra shipping charge for a multiple-copy order! --


This groundbreaking book is a celebration of form, geometric shapes in beadwork, and structure with intent, and is suitable for beaders of all skill levels. Beginning beaders will be excited and challenged by the shapes, but led gently into the ideas with simple projects, and advanced beaders will have their socks knocked off by the straightforward approach, the nifty thread paths, and the alluring shapes that grow, unsupported, from simple peyote stitch.

We post lots of updates on our blogs and on the book's Facebook page, so please follow us to keep informed.

http://www.katemckinnon.com
http://beadmobile.wordpress.com/
https://www.facebook.com/ContemporaryGeometricBeadwork

CGB is likely on the shelf at your local bead store- if not, please ask them about it. Contact Kate for wholesale orders at kate@katemckinnon.com, or order from Helby/Beadsmith.

name: Glorious CGB Souvenir Calendar!
description:
This amazingly beautiful, limited edition calendar will cover 20 months of human time, beginning January, 2014. It was shot by Kyle Cassidy and Ali Megan, and features not only work from Volume I, but a sneak peek of Volume II, including an as-yet unpublished advance pattern.  

Proceeds from the sale of this calendar support our many donated copies of the books to libraries, bead societies, and schools, and we thank you for helping make that possible.

name: Pre-order for Love Letters
description:
This exquisite project in the works from Kate McKinnon and a revolving crew of interesting people is slated for Christmas, 2014.

A limited number of pre-orders will be taken for the project; they are meant only to fund the interview phase; after that the magazines and our publisher will take over.

This pre-order package will include an autographed copy of the professionally produced and published book, the live digital version, an EP, and a card deck.

For more information, please see our Book Blog at www.loveletters.org.
 
If you'd like updates on our progress to press, please click "Subscribe" at the top left of the blog.

name: Sculptural Metal Clay & The Jewelry Architect
description:
These two well-received books, published through Interweave Press in 2011, detail a variety of methods for creating handmade jewelry or small sculptures, and focus on technique and craftsmanship over pattern. I'm not carying these books in my studio at this time, but you can pick them up at your local bookstore, or through online sites such as Powells or Amazon.com.

Excerpts of some of the outstanding reviews:

The Jewelry Architect:

"McKinnon presents an intriguing, highly professional way to create beaded jewelry that doesn't resemble loving hands at home. 'I'm a maker of components, an engineer of connections,' McKinnon says, and throughout the 15 projects and seven structural elements (e.g., clasps, ear wires, ring findings) she discusses, it's clear that the engineering conceit fuels her work. Curiously, much of the volume's presentation centers on beading, a craft she learned as a child. Yet her incorporation of best-possible materials, whether a slew of Victorian buttons or already fashioned felt cupcakes, distinguishes each design.... So, if today is Tuesday, do we opt to fashion and wear a dramatic mechanical chain, the whimsical Puck's bracelet, or the extraordinarily intricate corset-stitch cuff? Many top-notch choices." - Barbara Jacobs, Booklist *Starred Review*

“Let Kate be one of your teachers. Get the book, read it carefully, and watch the DVD over and over until it is imbedded into your brain. I learned something about myself and my own creative philosophies by reflecting on hers. I wish the same for you”. - Bsueboutiques.typepad.com

"My favorite jewelry-making book of all time." - Tammy Jones, JewelryMakingDaily.com



Sculptural Metal Clay:

"Insightful tips and instructions for unique designs that inspire jewelry makers to create outside the box." — Detroit News

"Kate McKinnon is a master of form and a delight to read. Her new book...even comes with a DVD so that you can have Kate guide you...as if she were right there with you." — Beading-Arts.com

"In the 60 minute DVD, she comes off relaxed and professional on screen and easily demonstrates that she not only knows her stuff when it comes to metal clay and metalsmithing, but she also knows how to teach, something you don't always find with artists." – Tammy Powley, editor, About.com Guide to Jewelry Making

"Kate McKinnon’s fine silver metal clay pieces are stunning and wonderfully architectural in design. This book will not disappoint!" – Bead Unique

"As a teacher, Kate McKinnon is nonpareil. The book is perfectly beautiful in its presentation, with excellent clear and informative photographs, whether of the tools you will require or of the projects offered. The DVD reinforces aspects of the book which you may have missed." – Australian Beading Magazine

"Kate is, quite possibly, the best jewelry engineer I have ever met. Her work is not only structurally sound, built to last and comfortable, but it has just that right edgy *snap* to make it truly artful." - Jean Campbell, former editor, Beadwork magazine

"There is something to be said for an artist who focuses entirely on one medium with a relentless specificity. What happens is an alchemy of sorts, a magic that can only be forged from patience, tenacity and the willingness to dig deep." - Margot Potter, The Impatient Crafter
